SENT.plain: The canine middle cerebral has been embolized using the method of Molinari
Microsurgical embolectomies were done at two hours and six hours post-embolism
Animals done at two hours remained virtually intact neurologically, and hence fared better than control dogs whose embolus remained in place
Animals done six hours post embolism had increased neurologic morbidity and mortality as compared to the controls
Pathologic study revealed hemorrhagic infarctions in 50% of the animals done six hours post embolism
